author: pietjepuk
content:
>  the nodes in it's mesh (6 by default) would get the message and ignore it
From what I can tell, new messages (built by/originating from your own node) are "published" by default in gossipsub v1.1 [0]. So they are sent to _all_ connected peers, which could easily be hundreds [1].

[0] https://github.com/libp2p/specs/blob/master/pubsub/gossipsub/gossipsub-v1.1.md#flood-publishing
[1] For libp2p-rust, default config is https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/blob/2a14df25eb0b26bcffab2f62f823eb3e9fb39772/protocols/gossipsub/src/config.rs#L451  (not overridden by LH). Used in publish routine here https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/blob/eb5e2691654ea4bbb97341a53f5c55397bd7bed3/protocols/gossipsub/src/behaviour.rs#L640

author: pietjepuk
content: Yep, took some non-trivial modifying of Lighthouse in a language I don't/didn't really speak (Rust), but it worked. Fun exercise though, playing around with local testnets and the like!
